meanings.definition: To express an intention to harm or punish someone.
meanings.sent1: He was threating to tell the teacher about the broken window.
meanings.sent2: The bully was threating his classmates with mean words.
meanings.sent3: The little boy was threating to not share his toys with his sister.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were threating to unleash their fury on the town.
meanings.sent5: The criminal's eyes were threating as he planned his next move.

meanings.definition: To be a source of danger or harm to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The dark alley looked threating to the scared child.
meanings.sent2: The wild animal's growls were threating to the hikers.
meanings.sent3: The old house seemed threating to the curious explorers.
meanings.sent4: The sharp thorns on the plant were threating to anyone who got too close.
meanings.sent5: The looming deadline was threating to ruin her weekend plans.
